title: Frequent seeking causes "failed to authenticate decrypted block - bad password?" on encrypted ACD
body:
> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
> rclone v1.33-83-g8710741Î²

Plex scanning on an encrypted Amazon Cloud Drive mount throws _ReadFileHandle.Read io.Seeker failed: failed to authenticate decrypted block - bad password?_ errors.

The file is always different, and reading them from the beginning to the end is working without any problem.

Here is an example with only the relevant file:

```
file1: Dir.Lookup
file1: Dir.Lookup OK
file1: File.Attr
file1: File.Open
file1: ReadFileHandle.Read size 4096 offset 25944064
file1: ReadFileHandle.seek from 0 to 25944064 (io.Seeker)
file1: ReadFileHandle.Read OK
file1: ReadFileHandle.Read size 16384 offset 0
file1: ReadFileHandle.seek from 25945952 to 0 (io.Seeker)
file1: ReadFileHandle.Read OK
file1: ReadFileHandle.Read size 4096 offset 45056
file1: ReadFileHandle.seek from 16384 to 45056 (io.Seeker)
file1: ReadFileHandle.Read OK
file1: ReadFileHandle.Read size 4096 offset 77824
file1: ReadFileHandle.seek from 49152 to 77824 (io.Seeker)
file1: ReadFileHandle.Read io.Seeker failed: failed to authenticate decrypted block - bad password?
file1: ReadFileHandle.Read size 4096 offset 77824
file1: ReadFileHandle.seek from 49152 to 77824 (io.Seeker)
file1: ReadFileHandle.Read io.Seeker failed: failed to authenticate decrypted block - bad password?
file1: ReadFileHandle.Read size 4096 offset 77824
file1: ReadFileHandle.seek from 49152 to 77824 (io.Seeker)
file1: ReadFileHandle.Read io.Seeker failed: failed to authenticate decrypted block - bad password?
file1: ReadFileHandle.Read size 4096 offset 77824
file1: ReadFileHandle.seek from 49152 to 77824 (io.Seeker)
file1: ReadFileHandle.Read io.Seeker failed: failed to authenticate decrypted block - bad password?
file1: ReadFileHandle.Read size 4096 offset 77824
file1: ReadFileHandle.seek from 49152 to 77824 (io.Seeker)
file1: ReadFileHandle.Read io.Seeker failed: failed to authenticate decrypted block - bad password?
file1: ReadFileHandle.Flush
file1: ReadFileHandle.Flush OK
file1: ReadFileHandle.Release closing
file1: ReadFileHandle.Release OK
```

I believe the issue is related to the frequent seeking in the file, possibly a missing lock.
